Articles.Content:
1 Question i'm setting up a new space station...And for some reason my map i don't have that gray thing so i can't see or know if i have a orbit around kerbin. Can you help me fix it where i can see if i have an orbit around kerbin? all i see is blue pink and orange lines please help me?

Edited October 31, 2013 by Lolkillalevi
The orbit of the ship your currently flying is shown in blue, and encounter are shown in orange

The orbit of the ship your currently flying is shown in blue, and encounter are shown in orange

Okay, So like my ships orbit is in blue and so it's pointing to kerbin escape, Can you tell me if i'm good enough to where i won't fall down back into earth because my last station did that and i've been flying this one for a while now..and the earth is like medium size i passed the mun waaaaaaaaaaaaaayyyy and going twords the sun.

I'll tell you my meters right now

Orbit

64186.3m/s
A screen shot of what you are seeing would help us explain what is going on.
Show us some screenshots of what you mean

k

I'll show a screenshot where i'm at and the map

just wait for next reply
If Kerbin escape shows its exactly what it says, your ship will escape Kerbin if you leave it on its current orbit
Yes, your on an escape trajectory from Kerbin, if you continue on this orbit you'll end up on a solar orbit, orbiting Kerbol
So i'm good i won't start falling back into kerbin? (I'm new i don't get what escape means yet Sorry :/)
Yep, you will leave the Kerbin SOI and enter Kerbols SOI ... the interesting task will be, to get back

So i'm good i won't start falling back into kerbin? (I'm new i don't get what escape means yet Sorry :/)

That means, finally you wonÃ‚Â´t orbit Kerbin, but instead Kerbol (the sun)

Escape means you are leaving its gravity well and you will no longer be orbiting it. If your planned space station is in Kerbin orbit this is bad. Have you just been burning straight up this whole time?

Your actualy a bit "too good" if you want to orbit Kerbin I highly recommend you turn your ship around immediately and start firing your engines,

If your orbit goes into the planet or the lowest part isn't above 70,000 meters, your going to crash into the planet, if you have a Kerbin escape, your going to escape from Kerbin and its moons entirely, and you'll end up orbiting Kerbol without being able to see Kerbin.

If the orbit path goes around the planet and comes back around to you then your in orbit around the planet
Yup, you won't be hitting kerbin any time soon. With no fuel left I think they will be lost orbiting kerbol for quite some time.
Go watch youtube video's, EVERYTHING is explained in there.

Go watch youtube video's, EVERYTHING is explained in there.

So hey, does that mean we can close this subforum? At least try to be a little more helpful here.

K i actually was using debug menu just to get my station ready and stat, then turn everything off, so i'm good now yay. And it's suppose to be a station, I don't think i'll be recovering them instead of on EVA...Or rescue mission, Dang...I didn't think my mission out to well...

Okay, So like my ships orbit is in blue and so it's pointing to kerbin escape, Can you tell me if i'm good enough to where i won't fall down back into earth because my last station did that and i've been flying this one for a while now..and the earth is like medium size i passed the mun waaaaaaaaaaaaaayyyy and going twords the sun.

I'll tell you my meters right now

Orbit

64186.3m/s

Well, the 64186 m/s is your speed (with other words, every second you cover a distance of 64 km ... for an Orbit 100km above Kerbin you would need a little bit more than 2 km/s in horizontal speed above kerbins surface))

Your altitude above Kerbin is 34334 km.
K...I think i'm going to go for mission Return the Space Station guys, If i see they're in danger...

K...I think i'm going to go for mission Return the Space Station guys, If i see they're in danger...

DonÃ‚Â´t worry ... they wonÃ‚Â´t be in danger anymore for a long time (unless the danger is "boredom") ... after leaving Kerbins gravity well they will (most probably) no more get in the vicinity of anything they could hit (unless you, by chance, got their trajectory right that they hit another planet ... but considering the vastness of space, this is rather improbable )
I'm re-doing my mission...I just started a new sandbox...I gotta re-think this mission :/

K...I think i'm going to go for mission Return the Space Station guys, If i see they're in danger...

Safe is a relative term at this point. You have officially got them lost in space. Not sure where you were going to place that space station but now its going to be a deep space station.
You don't have to start a new sandbox, if you want to restart the flight, hit esc and click revert flight, then hit revert to launch

DonÃ‚Â´t worry ... they wonÃ‚Â´t be in danger anymore for a long time (unless the danger is "boredom") ... after leaving Kerbins gravity well they will (most probably) no more get in the vicinity of anything they could hit (unless you, by chance, got their trajectory right that they hit another planet ... but considering the vastness of space, this is rather improbable )

Oh i didn't see you replied before i started a new sandbox All my work is now...Gone! I need someone to help me through my new space station mission...Or atleast get to mun to setup a base.
